A button that uses the full width of the screen looks like this:
A disabled button looks like this (any size):
With TLSMetric the network connections of all apps and the android system can be shown. This "Privacy Friendly" Version of TLSMetric uses minimal permissions and does not store or transmit any data.
On touch of the start button, TLSMetric starts a passive daemon which monitors all ongoing network connections. A background notification will inform you of the ongoing monitoring.
Use the button in the lower left corner to call the Welcome Dialog.
More information can be found on:
What is Privacy Friendly App Example?
Privacy Friendly App Example is an app that demonstrates the design of a Privacy Friendly App.
Privacy Friendly App Example does not require any permission. It further does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement.
Privacy Friendly App Example does not require any permission.

This App serves as a guideline to see the basic design of Privacy Friendly Apps. The sourcecode is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the Privacy Friendly App Guide.\n\nThe welcome screen should introduce the app and the key elements of the start page.
